Subject: junit 4 - generating a test suite at runtime for each pair of tests.

--------------060000080207060007060405
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

using junit 4, i have a test case 
<http://xunitpatterns.com/Testcase%20Class.html> that has n test methods 
<http://xunitpatterns.com/Test%20Method.html>, one of the test methods 
fails when the test case is run. and this failing test method succeeds 
when run by itself.

i would like to dynamically (at run time) create a set of test suites 
<http://xunitpatterns.com/Test%20Suite%20Object.html> (or test cases), 
one for each pair of test methods in the test case.

so a test case with 3 test methods would generate 3!=6 test suites (or 
test cases).

thanks

--

  <body bgcolor="#FFFFFF" text="#000000">
    <p>using junit 4, i have a <a
        href="http://xunitpatterns.com/Testcase%20Class.html"
        rel="nofollow">test case</a> that has n <a
        href="http://xunitpatterns.com/Test%20Method.html"
        rel="nofollow">test methods</a>, one of the test methods fails
      when the test case is run. and this failing test method succeeds
      when run by itself.</p>
    <p>i would like to dynamically (at run time) create a set of <a
        href="http://xunitpatterns.com/Test%20Suite%20Object.html"
        rel="nofollow">test suites</a> (or test cases), one for each
      pair of test methods in the test case.</p>
    <p>so a test case with 3 test methods would generate 3!=6 test
      suites (or test cases).<br>
    </p>
    <p>thanks<br>
    </p>
